video_title: Investing on the Edge: Funding Frontier AI - SuperAI Singapore 2025
description:
Learn more about SuperAI: superai.com
Follow us on X: x.com/superai_conf

Panel: Investing on the Edge: Funding Frontier AI

Speakers:
Andy Tang, Partner @ Draper Associates
Khailee Ng, Managing Partner @ 500 Global
Hemant Mohapatra, Partner @ Lightspeed India Partners

Moderator:
Jeanie Fang, Director, Data and AI @ Crunchbase

Stage: io.net Main Stage
#superai #china #ai #agi #llms

Recorded on 18 June 2025

yourself your background and your fund starting with you Andy great good afternoon everyone my name is Andy Tang um um with Draper Associates and I joined the firm in 2007 um and you probably have either heard of or worked with my partner Tim Draper so we have been investing together last uh 20 years uh and I'm a generalist and we're early stage venture fund seed to growth uh and happy to be here hi I'm Kylie 500 global uh we built our firm based on this idea that like the largest outcomes in the world have the majority of their revenues outside of the US but also including the US so whether it's going up from like 10 billion 50 100 all the way up you see this percentage go up so to build a platform that can invest in companies and take them all around the world what does that look like and how can we build that across decades so today we managed about two bill over $2 billion we've invested in 3,000 companies in 80 countries we got a network of partners and hopefully we can like build up to that dream um yeah that's me um very glad to be here uh always a pleasure um thank you for having us i'm H Mahapatra from Lightseed lightseed is a global venture capital firm based in Silicon Valley parts of Europe India Singapore and China he managed about $30 billion of capital globally and uh you know very very active uh investors in uh AI globally we've made the first three in case you don't know you do uh electricity um actually before that steam engine steam engine electricity and electronics so think about how each one of those things change the way um we live how humanity evolve and then that level impact and that's how we kind of think about what we think about the frontier AI um and I'll kind of give a very short example of how I think about idea of the ability to have um sort of problem solving uh multimodal reasoning um planning execution um if you put all that together I think that makes it a really interesting um frontier AI um and people alex are you sure that's not just your wife omni knowing i don't know man um look I mean I I I agree with I think what has been said let me let me put a different perspective on this um look I think the world and the way we see it we see kind of pretty much whatever is happening around the world in AI and it's it's actually one of the most interesting times at least in my venture career um every 30 40 maybe 50 years the world goes through what I call an innovation super cycle uh what is a super cycle a super cycle starts when you know 30 40 years of research that has literally gone to the ground in some cases like in the case of oil and steam it unlocks a new resource that you can then scientifically discover extract and then commercialize and when you are able to scientifically discover extract and commercialize in a repeatable way that resource over time becomes ubiquitous cheap and available to everybody and if it is a programmable resource like steam is programmable uh oil is programmable uh CPUs are programmable GPUs are programmable AI token is programmable when these resources are programmable then you can unlock a new industry in its entirety so what happened 100 years ago before oil became commercially and readily available 30 40 50 years of research had gone into figuring out where the hell to dig so that oil comes out from the ground and one the US figured it out they ended up occupying every country that had potential for oil because they knew that if I go to this region or that region and I dig I will get oil and and that super cycle that took 50 60 70 80 years to run its course meant that if you are in the beginning of the super cycle the frontier of the super cycle is the extractive part of the industry the companies that extract oil and make it available for others to do something with are at the frontier as the cycle matures those who are extracting are no longer the frontier anymore they become commoditized the value moves upstream it's about what you do with the oil the car companies acrew value the airplane companies acrew value petroleum product companies acrew value if you invested in a uh Exxon stock in 1990s you would have basically come about at the same price 20 30 years later the right place to put your money was a different frontier called internet so the same thing happened with CPUs and the CPU cycle became commoditized the value moved from putting money into an AMD or Intel to putting money into a Google or a Microsoft today what's happening is we are going through we have gone through 30 40 years of ex of research and development and now we have extracted this new godlike resource that you talked about which is an AI token which is programmable and readily available and getting cheaper by the minute and the first few years of an extractive cycle you should put money the frontier is the extractive businesses who extracts the GPU cycles the GPU companies the uh the companies that are building the uh the the fabs Right tsmc's above that are foundation model companies above that are data companies above that are application companies so we have very quickly moved from the frontier being AS6 and GPUs to maybe foundation model companies that will get commoditized over time to then it's the middleware companies which was the hottest sector last year to now what we are coming to is the application layer companies and a genetic infra company which is where the frontier is and tomorrow the frontier might be doing science with AI doing research and development with AI so that's how the frontier moves and if you are missing the boat and you put money into a the previous cycle of what Frontier used to be you will lose money so you got to be as investors we got to be very cutting edge all the time but that's what we think about when we think about Frontier as what is currently h has the most alpha and where are in the cycle we are because the cycles also compress very quickly what took 80 years for oil would not take more than 80 years for AI uh can I riff on what he just shared i think that's actually a very refreshing and insightful way to kind of parse where the idea of
